intro: Tragacantha cephalotes, commonly known as the crown thorn, is a shrub native to the arid regions of the Arabian Peninsula. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, showy flowers. The plant produces a sticky, resinous substance known as tragacanth, which has been historically used in medicine and as a binding agent. It is well adapted to harsh environments, with deep roots and a low, sprawling growth habit. Tragacantha cephalotes plays a role in stabilizing desert soils and providing habitat for desert wildlife.
